add 0134-WebUI-Add-ShowInternalSysvars patch (#1400)

* add 0134-WebUI-Add-ShowInternalSysvars patch

* modified button translations to better fit existing naming scheme.

* integrated a slight style change to make the action column more compact.

* we use a light gray background to distinguish internal from non-internal
system variables.

* disable Edit button for internal+unerasable sysvars.

* we check for ID_GW_SYSSERVICE and ID_GW_SYSALARM for disabling the edit
button rather than internal&&unerasable

author: jens-maus
message:
reworked /bin/triggerAlarm.tcl to actually create the "Alarmzone 1"
system variable if it is doesn not exist anymore. This script can also
take an additional argument with a alarm variable name now and
generate/use that instead. This should allow to have arbitrary alarm
messages/variables now and not rely on "Alarmzone 1" only anymore.

other rpi* targets.

faster since lz4 should perform way better than standard gzip.

author: jens-maus
message:
before using the result of DPByControl() queries we check if these
queries returned non-null results and only continue then. This should
fix problems where the MAINTENANCE (:0) channel of a RPI-RF-MOD might
not have a MAINTENANCE.CARRIER_SENSE_LEVEL and thus "null" was returned
and a watchdog alarm generated.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated separate dt overlay fragment sections to wipe the stdout-path
in the <chosen> dt overlay section so that u-boot won't pick this up.
With newer raspberrypi kernel versions the stdout-path was set to a
default serial port which caused u-boot to pick that up as the stdout
path, thus resulting in crashes if the rpi-rf-mod dtbo was loaded.
(cf. https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/issues/2919)

message:
added hardware support for the pimoroni Fan SHIM HAT
(https://learn.pimoroni.com/tutorial/sandyj/getting-started-with-fan-shim) by adding a new
"raspi-fanshim" service which will be automatically started if a
/etc/config/enableFanshim status file is present. It will then
automatically turn on/off the fan if the temperature is reaching 65
degree or turn it of under 50 degree. This closes #811.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated a first fix for being able to use a = character in device
parameter strings (often used by CUxD). Previously the "=" character
could not be used because the corresponding regular expression to split
an URL parameter like "CMD=A=B" failed because the regexp was splitting
it into "CMD=A" and "B" rather than in "CMD" and "B". With the patch of
ic_common.tcl this issue should be fixed now. This refs #888 and
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=37&t=60401

author: jens-maus
message:
we set HOSTCC/HOSTCXX in the embedded buildroot build in the multilib32
and recovery-system packages to HOSTCC_NOCCACHE/HOSTCXX_NOCCACHE so that
the host packages are compiled without any ccache as we anyway use
CCACHE within the buildroot builds. This should fix the recently broken
builds after having enabled BR2_CCACHE in general.

author: jens-maus
message:
some people seem to feel disturbed by the various PayPal badges and
mentionings on the possibility to donate money to RaspberryMatic,
thus think RaspberryMatic is a commercial project. To make absolutely
clear that RaspberryMatic is a free, independent and non-commercial open
source project with no commercial intension whatsoever, we remove all
direct paypal mentionings on various places in our repository/WebUI and
route users just to the project homepage instead.

author: jens-maus
message: integrated WebUI patch to allow to install CCU addons without forcing a reboot afterwards. Only if the addon 'update_script' returns 10 as an exit code this will be taken as a successful install, but signaling the calling routines to perform a reboot afterwards.

author: jens-maus
message:
added oom_score_adj modifications so that our important homematic
services are guaranteed to be the last processes being killed due to out
of memory situations. This closes #540.

added empty BR2_TARGET_ROOTFS_EXT2_MKFS_OPTIONS so that a 64bit ext4
filesystem is generated for the rootfs which should potentially behave
more fast&secure.

author: jens-maus
message:
set net.ifnames=0 as default kernel option to stop udev from renaming
net devices to own naming rules and use the traditional ethX wlanX
naming scheme instead. This make the
/lib/udev/rules.d/99-persistent-net.rules files obsolete for the same
effect but on selected devices only.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed a potential /var/log tmpfs overflow which could happen in
excessive logging conditions because logrotate is only called once per
day and syslogd was setup to not rotate any logfiles itself. Now we set
a hard limit to 4MB and also let logrotate compress a potential
/var/log/messages.1 file generated by syslogd.

author: jens-maus
message: limit a github actions job to max 8h runtime.

author: jens-maus
message: changed LED setup in recovery mode to heartbeat the red POWER LED instead.

author: jens-maus
message: moved all kernel patches from buildroot-external/patches/linux/ to board specific patch locations so that we can use board specific patches (e.g. if we start supporting other hardware than raspberrypi anytime soon).

author: jens-maus
message: minor change to deploy.sh to potentially fir CI check.

author: jens-maus
message: updated generic_raw_uart package to use latest sources with pl011_raw_uart 1.3 with incorporated crash fixes.

author: jens-maus
message: don't allow remote ReGa script API requests on port 80+443 anymore to improve security. Only scripting requests to port 8181 or 48181 are allowed.

author: jens-maus
message: finalized support for PIco UPS HAT hardware by using a shell-script driven daemon rather than the rpi-ups-pico daemon which still doesn't work with newer firmware versions of the PIco UPS HAT. This closes #62.

author: jens-maus
message: fixed wiringpi tinkerboard build by adding the missing TINKER_BOARD define to the build commands.

author: jens-maus
message:
we don't generate vhdx and vdi images but just use vmdk for our ova
builds.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated fix for 0097-WebUI-SetSysvarValueByUser to use replace()
rather than the newer replaceAll() which seems to be not supported by
all recent browsers yet. This closes #1150.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented an eMMC life-time check watchdog job which will regularly
check any existing '/sys/block/<diskid>/device/life_time' entry
and raise a watchdog alarm in case the life time value exceeds 90%
or higher. This check should come handy on systems with onboard or
external eMMC storage solutions (e.g. ASUS Tinkerboard) and will
regulary monitot the health status of the eMMC wear leveling.

author: jens-maus
message: if there is no /etc/config/hmip_address.conf on a fresh installation we create it so that the hmip address and hmrf address will be the same.

author: jens-maus
message:
use the same java 8.50.51.263-ca-jdk8.0.275 version for aarch32hf then we use
for arm64, etc.

author: jens-maus
message: put the VERSION file into the top-level of rootfs and link it according from /boot/VERSION. In future we will have to move away from using /boot/VERSION because the version file needs to be different for each partition reflecting the updated version they are belonging to.

author: jens-maus
message: added rootdelay=5 to help USB drives to spin up before trying to be mounted as a root device.

author: jens-maus
message:
we don't stop when a detect_radio_module call on a raw-uart device
without anything connected doesn't return anything because it could be
that not on every raw-uart device a valid rf module is connected.
This refs #910.

author: jens-maus
message:
added "iomem=relaxed" to kernel bootargs of all platforms coming with
wiringpi. This should fix "Operation not permitted" issues since we
hardended the kernels for more secure DEVMEM. Now wiringpi should
work again while still ensuring a high access security.

automatically started before starting HMIPServer and which will try to

message:
make sure the control tables are always 100% wide even if they are
empty.

author: jens-maus
message: added the 'bcm2709-rpi-2-b' device tree desription file to BR2_LINUX_KERNEL_INTREE_DTS_NAME which should basically enable RaspberryPi2(b) support. This refs #19.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated fixes in 0007-WebUI-Enhanced-FirmwareUpdate WebUI patch which
should fix the new auto-backup feature during the firmware update
process using the WebUI.

author: jens-maus
message:
modified 0046-WebUI-ImprovedScriptEditor WebUI patch to allow to resize
a CodeMirror based editor vertically. This should enable users to resize
the source code and output area in the script editor an script testing
popup to their needs. (cf.
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?p=760691)

author: HMside
message: Added patchset to prevent accidental uses of the browsers' backspace button which if used will otherwise result in creation of a new session and thus will complicated WebUI use.

author: jens-maus
message:
added --ignore-missing-args to rsync call so that rsync won't fail for
platforms not having multilib32.

author: jens-maus
message: final 3.45.7.20190511 release version bump.

author: jens-maus
message:
optimized 0109-WebUI-Fix-SystemLanguageDefaultNames WebUI patch by
securing all cObj uses via if() calls which should catch invalid null
accesses to invalid iseobject ids resulting from e.g. partly broken ise
lists like ID_SYSTEM_VARIABLES, etc.
This refs https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=65568

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jens-maus/RaspberryMatic

author: jens-maus
message: added "ethtool" as a new standard tool to RaspberryMatic to allow for querying+tuning ethernet link/type parameters.

author: jens-maus
message:
use baseboard-manufacturer instead of system-product-name for
identifying an Intel NUC.

author: jens-maus
message:
added new 0140-WebUI-Add-ChannelPicsInControl WebUI patch which will add
channel pictures to the status and control tables.

author: jens-maus
message: remove direct reference to crRFD.conf in our overlay again as we are modifying it on the fly anyway now.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed kernel defconfig to get a first working raspberrypi4 kernel booted
by our patched u-boot 2019.07 version.

author: jens-maus
message:
add multilib32 package to the package list of packages we use from the
top-level buildroot build rather than rebuilding it again in the
recovery system build. This should hopefully speed up the recovery
system build enough so that the nightly build finish in time again.

author: jens-maus
message: updated build environment to use defconfig files instead of having top-level Config.XXXX files.

author: jens-maus
message: changed create_patches.sh to always create patches with a 0000- prefix because additional patches might mix up the order of patches.

author: jens-maus
message: use the new "stale" label for explicitly labeling issues as "stale"

author: jens-maus
message:
reworked query_rf_parameters() to try to identify the rf module type by
first querying HM-MOD-RPI-PCB parameters using eq3configcmd followed by
hmip-copro-update.jar queries to identify if the rf module is a
RPI-RF-MOD.

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'master' into hmip-rfusb

author: jens-maus
message:
added a new 0086-WebUI-Fix-500Errors WebUI bugfix patch which will fix
"Error 500" errors that occur due to to Ajax.Request() executions not
being responded properly via "puts" exections. This refs #959.

author: jens-maus
message: bumped linux kernel version to 4.9.20 and modified bcm2835_raw_uart sources to compile properly. This refs #89.

author: jens-maus
message: more kernel defconfig changes to get the tinkerboard kernel working again.

author: jens-maus
message: integrated latest armbian changes to move towards kernel 4.14.y for tinkerboard as well.

author: jens-maus
message: updated homematic.mk with git id of updated OCCU 2.25.15 release with a fixed HMServer.jar. This fixes #20.

author: jens-maus
message:
add ntp.drift file definition so that the frequency drift values are
also stored for subsequent starts of the ntp daemon.

author: jens-maus
message: explicitly use ubuntu-20.04 for our test builds.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed the 0024-WebUI-Filter-Operations patch which was slightly broken
after the 3.53.27 OCCU upgrade.

author: jens-maus
message:
users can put a SetupWIFI file also in /etc/config to get the WiFi
connection setup done semi-automatically upon bootup.

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'master' into recovery-mode

author: jens-maus
message:
added apparmor support and tuned config.json a bit to route certain
devices to the RaspberryMatic HA add-on.

author: jens-maus
message:
reworked S60multimacd init script to not use a "sleep 5" workaround for
allowing /dev/eq3loop to settle, but use a multimacd process restart
routine instead in case the mmd devices are missing after startup.
This refs #1707.

author: jens-maus
message: removed i2c-rtc device tree overlay again as this conflicts with the initialization routines in S00eQ3SystemStartup

author: jens-maus
message: Update README.md

author: jens-maus
message: updated tailscale to 1.28.0

author: jens-maus
message: we have to initialized /dev/urandom way earlier than during S20urandom. That's why we need own initialization routines in S00eQ3SystemStart.

author: jens-maus
message: fixed S01InitHost to use heartbeat-led for /sys/class/leds and fixed rk3288-tinker patch to get rpi_rf_mod leds setup correctly.

author: jens-maus
message: modified rssiInfo query to use rssiinfo.tcl also for HmIP-RF as well as for BidCos-RF. This should update RSSI values on every device list reload.

author: jens-maus
message:
if /etc/config/neoDisabled is set we remove also the www link and
/usr/local/addons/mediola upon startup so that fs should be clean as
well.

author: jens-maus
message: add ntfs as a valid usbmount filesystem and enable the "sync" option in recovery mode.

author: jens-maus
message: minor qemu-guest-agent package changes.

author: jens-maus
message: fixed WebUI patches so that they can be applied without any errors.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed 0037-WebUI-DevConfig-RSSI patch by explicitly using a catch{}
statements to query for the devname of a HmIP device because it seems
that under some circumstances this array is not populated correctly and
thus otherwise ends up in an error when the "set rssi_list" is executed.
This refs #845.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a new WebUI fix patch (0067-WebUI-Fix-BrokenLinkPeerList) which
fixes issues in case SENDER_LINKCOUNTER/RECEIVER_LINKCOUNTER does not
contain a certain link peer, thus resulting in a severe tclsh error
being displayed in the WebUI. Now a proper table is generated and the
broken link will be correctly displayed instead.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated an upstream change to integrate avahi for autoip management
in case no DHCP server is present to deliver dynamic IP addresses.

author: jens-maus
message:
Merge pull request #205 from robdg80/patch-1

Update README.md

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated a regression fix for updating spectrum.js to 1.8.1
(refs #2102)

author: jens-maus
message: added a bcm43xx related fix for /usr/bin/hciattach taken from https://github.com/libretro/Lakka/commit/25646a66629899b21307c3e6e8a357c5ee7f9200 and which fixes the issue that we required multiple calls to hciattach to flahs the firmware and init the bcm43xx device in one run. This finalizes bluetooth support and closes #43.

author: jens-maus
message:
updated linux kernel to latest stable versions available and modified
recovery-system default config to use the same kernel version as defined
in the top-level defconfig files rather than having to bump them each
and everytime we bump the top-level kernel versions.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed /bin/checkRpi4Usb3.sh script to correctly identify a GPIO
connected RF module for the rpi4usb3 warning.

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'master' into raspberrypi4

author: jens-maus
message: we load the rtc module for the tinkerboard explicitly in S02InitRTC now.

author: jens-maus
message: Update README.md

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'master' into tcl-update

author: jens-maus
message: version bump to flag latest stable release and updated announcement for the public.

author: jens-maus
message: updated linux kernel to 4.9.46 with the corresponding rpi-firmware package.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented openresolv/resolvconf support so that the resolv.conf DNS
config management can be performed dynamically in future rather than
always generating a static resolv.conf file.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a new WebUI bugfix patch which should fix a WebUI stalling or miss
display if a user favorite added system variable contained various HTML
tags which on one hand displayed correctly on the normal system variable
display but failed when a user added this system variable to his user
favorite display on the main startpage. This fixes #856.

author: jens-maus
message:
updated generic_raw_uart commit id to match the same one as the
detect_radio_module commit id.

author: jens-maus
message:
revert upstream kernel to 5.10.36 because the latest 5.10.37 seems to
run into a kernel oops for the intel nuc platform due to iommu issues.
Using intel_iommu=off on the kernel cmdline seems to solve these issues
but for a moment we simply use the previous kernel version which seems
to work. This fixes #1275.

author: jens-maus
message: Update README.de.md

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated another minor style glitch fix to use all available space for
the favorite table.

author: jens-maus
message: create .firmwareUpdate as a link to the folder which contains the uploaded firmware files.

author: jens-maus
message: minor optimizations for eQ3StartNetwork if-up.d script.

author: jens-maus
message: applied minor fix to piusvd notify.sh script identifying the actual UPS event upon power loss/restore.

author: jens-maus
message: fix shellcheck linter errors

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed tailscale init script to use a full CIDR grep to identify
advertisable routes. This should omit any host routes which otherwise
could result in startup errors with tailscale. This fixes #1683.

author: jens-maus
message: replaced the WebUI homematic logos with slightly adapted versions based on our RaspberryMatic logo.

author: jens-maus
message: updated upstream kernel to latest 6.1.19

author: jens-maus
message:
enable framebuffer devices for intelnuc images as well so that we can
work without any DRM mode since we are mostly headless anyway.

author: jens-maus
message: integrated style glitch fixes for function control table.

author: jens-maus
message: forgot to commit changes to 0035-WebUI-Fix-SysVarPopups patch.

author: jens-maus
message: added support for f2fs flash disk filesystem and added it to the known filesystem type list for usbmount. This closes #423.

author: jens-maus
message: Update FUNDING.yml

author: jens-maus
message: enabled CONFIG_PREEMPT in our defconfig to generate a low-latency type of kernel again. While this doesn't provide as low latency as a full real-time kernel it should improve latency to some extend. This refs #21.

author: jens-maus
message:
re-added missing kernel patch to move the reserved_thermal thermal
device back to thermal_zone2, thus get cpu_thermal back to
thermal_zone0. This fixes #1159.

author: jens-maus
message: adapted splash screen logo to new ccu logo.

author: jens-maus
message: Update README.md

author: jens-maus
message: use "xf" instead of "xzf" to not limit compression to gzip.

author: jens-maus
message:
updated upstream lighttpd patch to use the latest official
lighttpd-1.4.65 version just released.

author: jens-maus
message: fixed conditional if

author: jens-maus
message: applied fix for /www/rega/esp/side.inc where EnumSpecialIDs() could have been used for non HSSDP objects and thus would end up in an ExecError/ScriptRuntimeError.

author: jens-maus
message:
slightly reworked S11InitRFHardware to perform the /etc/config/ids and
/etc/config/hmip_address.conf fallback management in a single unique
place rather than within each dedicated branch of the rf module
identification procedure. In addition, introduced new
HM_HMRF_ADDRESS_ACTIVE and HM_HMIP_ADDRESS_ACTIVE variables where we
put the currently used rf address rather than putting it into /var/ids
which now again contains the rf module hard-encoded default rf address.
This refs #900.

author: jens-maus
message:
explicitly enable CONFIG_OF_LIBFDT_OVERLAY rather than via a patch
against the U-boot Kconfig file.

author: jens-maus
message: updated tinkerboard dt patch.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a new 0136-WebUI-Add-Tailscale-VPN WebUI patch which will add
all necessary web control elements to start+stop a tailscale vpn
connection as well as linking to the authentication page which the
tailscale web client will display once it has been started and through
which we can then authenticate to tailscale.com. Furthermore, we add
dedicated proxy settings for the local tailscale auth page so that it
can be access via /tailscale.

author: jens-maus
message:
in addition to the firewall blocking on port 8099 for 172.30.32.2 we
also let the ha-proxy to abort requests with "403 Forbidden" if the
request don't initiate from 172.30.32.2.

author: jens-maus
message:
added another style glitch fix for the functions table to use a better
colgroup width to use all available space.

author: jens-maus
message: first experiments to use u-boot as a general purpose bootloader in future so that we can support different booting scenarios in future (e.g. PXE/TFTP network booting, etc.) as well as potential support for recovery partition management. This refs #104, #107 and #58.

author: jens-maus
message:
reworked top-level Makefile to be way mroe flexible and allow to call
build, release and clean for all supported platforms.

author: jens-maus
message: fixed minor sorting bug in new sorted menu webui patch. This fixes #695.

author: jens-maus
message: added "xinetd" support for allowing to define own internet service description files in /etc/config/xinet.d like this is possible for all common linux platforms. This closes #117.

author: psytester
message: set correct Content-Type in hmFunc.cgi of NEOserver (#726)

author: jens-maus
message: fixed ha-proxy.js url regex to catch also URLs starting like "\/ise\/..."

author: jens-maus
message: updated raspberrypi kernels to latest 4.19.66 version.

author: jens-maus
message: more release workflow changes/adaptions.

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'master' into pizero

author: jens-maus
message: adapted kernel patchsets to 5.15.x

author: jens-maus
message:
we use a lsblk call to identify the main mmcX device number of the
rootfs. This should fix issues where upon using an eMMC with a
tinkerboard the red led was constantly blinking because an incorrect
mmcX device number was selected. Now the number will be automatically
identified upon startup.

author: jens-maus
message: updated upstream kernel to latest 6.1.28 LTS.

author: jens-maus
message:
unfortunately release drafter is not the right tool for us since we
mostly work on master branch...

author: jens-maus
message: link the patches directory to the top-level one so that we will get the same patches applied.

author: jens-maus
message: added wait-delay to interface config file in recovery system to let the network setup wait long enough for eth0 to appear.

author: jens-maus
message:
removed CONFIG_FEATURE_CLEAN_UP from general Busybox config which seem
to be the reason why the passwd program crashes with the current BusyBox
environment. This closes #469.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed an issue where in case a /etc/config/rfd.conf file does not
contain any "[Interface 0]" section while however a local rf module
was found, rfd would never pickup the rf module for BidCos
communication. Thus, we add a fresh "[Interface 0]" section in these
cases now to get BidCos-RF running. (This refs
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=68169)

author: jens-maus
message: added check for /etc/config/wpa_supplicant.conf to start WiFi connection upon bootup. This refs #37.

author: jens-maus
message: updated VERSION.

author: jens-maus
message: slightly reworked the boot script to test for /usr/local/.recoveryMode and for /root/zImage and then decide together with the pulled down GPIO if recovery mode should be started or not.

author: jens-maus
message: updated occu github commit id to latest master version to grab latest ReGaHss Beta version available.

author: jens-maus
message:
updated rpi-eeprom package to incorporate latest pieeprom-2021-03-18.bin
Pi4 EEPROM fixing potential issues with older pi4 boards.

author: jens-maus
message:
updated the new tailscale package to directly use the tailscale sources
from github and cross-compile all binaries using go-lang rather than
directly using static builds provided by tailscale.com. This also
allowed to update tailscale to the very latest 1.14.4 version.

author: jens-maus
message: fix for incorrect pid file naming and output the exact hmserver type to be started/stopped.

author: jens-maus
message: integrated patch to support 64bit kernels when using eq3_char_loop kernel module (https://github.com/eq-3/occu/pull/76).

author: jens-maus
message: retire release-drafter and use create-release instead.

author: jens-maus
message: updated wiringpi-odroid to latest version in github project.

author: jens-maus
message: update upstream occu package use to 2.31.23-1 which includes ReGaHss R1.00.0388.0127.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a new 0125-WebUI-ChannelHighlights patch which will bring up more
device channel highlights in the device list using DEV_HIGHLIGHT
statements in webui.js. Thanks to @Maik2208 for preparing these
additional highlight statements which refs #1307.

author: jens-maus
message: added patch for whole /www directory path that should bring it to a 100% compatibility level compared to the files on a real CCU2.

author: jens-maus
message: use 4M for putting images on the sd card. Also show progress in [X/Y] for fwinstall.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed issue that tclrega.so/tclrpc/tclticks were not correctly installed
on our 32bit-only platforms (rpi2, rpi0, tinkerboard), thus left the
WebUI non-working.

author: jens-maus
message: added soem very handy 'ls' aliases to profile.d

author: eq-3-hmip
message: Added vertx option to checkUsrBackup.sh

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated minor fix for 0040-WebUI-AddonInstallNoReboot.patch which
should fix a 500 error because the action_install_start function doesn't
return anything on the final Ajax.request(). This refs #959.

author: jens-maus
message:
add bcm2711-rpi-400.dtb and bcm2711-rpi-cm4.dtb to add support
for RaspberryPi400 and Compute Module 4.

author: jens-maus
message: splitted the buildroot overlay directories into top-level and product-wise overlay directories so that we can use different overlay directories depending on the product in future.

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jens-maus/RaspberryMatic

author: fhirschmann
message:
Raspberry Pi zero USB Gadget Mode (#648)

* Add init script to optionally enable g_ether
* add udev rule to rename usb0 to eth0
* include note about gadget mode in README.md
* include dwc2.dtbo overlay
* move enabled flag to config subdir

author: jens-maus
message: updated NEOserver package to latest 2.4.8 version changes.

author: jens-maus
message: fixed bug where the system didn't identify correctly that no RF hardware is present at all so that HMServer will only be started for virtual group services, etc.

author: jens-maus
message:
don't remove hasNTP in eQ3StopNetwork which is also executed upon a
link down/up event which, however, won't restart the NTP server and thus
can end up in hasNTP never reappearing which then could end up in a
situation that the /bin/setHWClock.sh script reading out the RTC clock
rathern than writing it back.

author: jens-maus
message:
applied a bunch of more monit related configuration changes to monitor
services more smoothly, monitor filesystem space and also e.g. introduce
conditional monitor for services users can enable/disable (e.g. sshd).

author: jens-maus
message: try to get a ubuntu-19.10 runner

author: jens-maus
message:
added WebUI fix for fixing two security vulnerabilities
(CVE-2018-7296, CVE-2018-7300) by changing the access levels for certain
public JSON rpc functions from NONE to USER and removing obsolete ones.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated a new WebUI fix patch which fixes a crash bug when creating
new rooms/functions in the WebUI. There two event handlers were called
at the same time resulting in an undefined html element exception could
have resulted in a crashed browser session. This fixes #855.

author: jens-maus
message: updated upstream OCCU version to 2.31.23.

author: jens-maus
message: fix continues /media/usb1 warnings in a ova environment.

author: jens-maus
message:
we mount /dev_host in S06InitSystem rather than via /etc/fstab and also
try to mount it within the HA add-on so that we don't have to work with
the whole /dev of the host system.

author: jens-maus
message:
updated buildroot version to 2019.02.1 which comes with some important
security fixes.

author: jens-maus
message: updated kernel versions.

author: jens-maus
message:
use $$ in asset_name or otherwise the nightly build workflow won't check
if the current commit ID was already built or not.

author: jens-maus
message: integrated fix for 0021-WebUI-SharedObjects-Unit patch where updateSysVar() was called different than the initial user shared object display with units.

author: jens-maus
message: enabled buildroot lighttpd package and disabled the use of the binaries from OCCU. This refs #12.

author: jens-maus
message: updated java-azul version to 1.8.0_102 and modified S62HMServer startup script to use 128MB maximum heap size to improved memory caching, thus potentially speed of HMServer.

author: jens-maus
message: fixed multlib32 target selection.

author: jens-maus
message: fixed type in german translation for the AstroDelays WebUI patch.

author: jens-maus
message: this makes my life easier!

author: jens-maus
message:
added possibility to recovery system to also update the U-Boot
bootloader which is located ahead of all usual partitions. However,
this will only work if the new partition layout is used where
the bootfs is located 2048 sectors after the devie start so that there
is enough space left for larger U-boot binaries.

author: jens-maus
message: updated pi4 eeprom version to latest 2020-11-24 beta.

author: jens-maus
message: more fixes.

author: jens-maus
message: Update release-template.md

author: jens-maus
message: implemented an own waitStartupComplete() function rather than using the eq3configcmd to wait for HM(IP)Server startup. This should make HM(IP)Server Startup more verbose.

author: jens-maus
message: Update README.md

author: jens-maus
message: bumped OCCU to 3.53.34-2 to include ReGaHss R1.00.0388.0225

message: modified occu build to replace all XXX-WEBUI-VERSION-XXX occurances in /www and placed "?_version_=" to some javascript/css html include definitions to fix some more browser cache related issues with the WebUI. This refs #245.

author: jens-maus
message: Update README.md

author: jens-maus
message: Updated README.md with link to logo.

author: jens-maus

message:
only run the oci build+push step if this is our repository or push
events to pull requests will fail.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed NUT startup and patch to use group "nobody" instead of "nogroup"
which doesn't exist in buildroot 2020.08 anymore.

author: jens-maus
message: updated CCU-Firmware-Diff patch so that all OCCU<>CCU3 firmware differences are incorporated accordingly.

author: jens-maus
message:
modified checkPortForwarding.sh to query for the public IPv4 address
using different public services (ifconfig.me icanhazip.com
ipecho.net/plain ifconfig.co) instead of just a single one. This should
improve reliability of the public IPv4 query considerably.

author: jens-maus
message: ignore SC2153 warning on shellcheck linter for S99SetupLEDs

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jens-maus/RaspberryMatic

author: jens-maus
message:
added new WebUI fix to fix the broken direct connection sorting since
3.49.x

author: jens-maus
message: added an own kernel defconfig file to "board/raspberrypi3" to allow to tune kernel settings more easily in future.

author: jens-maus
message:
added anyword-hint.js to loaded CodeMirror addons so that the script
editor will have some basic autocompletion feature using Ctrl+Space.

author: jens-maus
message: more detail fixes for new bug report form.

author: jens-maus
message: added more verbosity to network startup so that in case no link/interface is found there is enough information about it.

author: jens-maus
message: integrated WebUI changeset kindly provided by Andreas Bünting (HMside) which adds a dedicate button to the HMscript edit window and allows to run/test a script accordingly. This closes #139.

author: jens-maus
message: fixed incorrect patch.

author: jens-maus
message: use hadolint v1.3.1

author: jens-maus
message: we don't use dt-blob.dts anymore.

author: jens-maus
message: move new updateAddonConfig.tcl from common "base" overlay to "base-raspmatic" because this is a raspberrymatic-only tool yet.

author: jens-maus
message: enabled BR2_PACKAGE_LIBUSB_COMPAT to enable USB support for NUT which still requires the older libusb compatibility. This closes #93.

author: jens-maus
message: added a minor workaround for potentially slow or broken /dev/hwrng devices which might either block the rng daemon startup for forever or for an unacceptable amount of time due to the "head -c1" access test stalling. Now we wait a maximum of 5 seconds for the test to complete or we use /dev/urandom right away to work around this matter. This refs #831 where newer versions of Synology VMM seem to provide slightly broken /dev/hwrng devices to guest systems.

author: jens-maus
message: updated RaspberryPi linux kernel to latest stable "raspberrypi-kernel_1.20180417-1" version (4.14.34) including its corresponding rpi-firmware.

author: jens-maus

author: jens-maus
message:
when resetting a raw-uart it can happen that a certain rf module type
(HmIP-RFUSB) does not support that procedure and returns an error.
However, we need to simply ignore that, thus dump that error to null.

changed monit configuration to check for an existing
/etc/config/internetCheckDisabled file which will cause the regular
monit-based internet check to be disabled and thus not cause any alarm
message if the internet connection is lost for a certain amount of time.
This closes #664.

author: jens-maus
message: we don't use rfd.conf and multimacd.conf from /usr/local anymore as these are files that are usually not modifyable by the user and just definde the RF hardware devices required to communicate, thus are not needed on /usr/local. In addition this should improve switching back to a, e.g. CCU2 more easily.

author: jens-maus
message:
slightly reworked the S11InitRFHardware startup script once more so that
the homematicIP stuff for a RPI-RF-MOD is required before the BidCos
info which makes the rf module info query somewhat more stable?!? In
addition, we only query the SGTIN, serial, etc. at the spots where we
need them. Furthermore we use "mv" instead of cp to more away an invalid
/etc/config/ids rather than simply deleting it. This refs #900.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated a bugfix for tclrega and tclrpc which will always convert all
input data to iso-8859-1 encoding rather than just in case the identity
encoding is not used. This should fix certain umlaut encoding issues
that could either be seen in the WebUI when renaming devices/channels,
but also when using the rega scripting or rpc api with remote calls and
utf-8 encoded names containing umlaut characters. This fixes #1821.

author: jens-maus
message:
there seems to be no need to disable net.ipv4.tcp_timestamps anymore
since newer kernels avoid security concerns by additional randomization
and in addition, potential network spikes should be neglectible here. So
keeping it at the default should have more positive effects than
disabling it. (cf.
https://security.stackexchange.com/questions/111794/pros-and-cons-of-disabling-tcp-timestamps)

use DEPLOY_TOKEN rather than GITHUB_TOKEN to prevent it from timing out

author: jens-maus
message:
added more european captial cities and countries to the global country
list. This closes #741.

author: jens-maus
message: added patch to remove all obsolete easymode hmip files which seem to be existing only in OCCU and not in the CCU2 anymore. These files seem to cause some trouble in trying to display device parameters for certain HmIP devices (e.g. all with a weekly schedule). This closes #173

author: jens-maus
message: adapted 0051-WebUI-Fix-eventDelayPrn to official patch to fix the issue.

author: jens-maus

author: jens-maus

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'raspberrypi4'. This refs #650.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed an issue with using lsblk to identify the mmc device of rootfs for
setting HM_LED_GREEN_MODE2 because lsblk seem to be not able to query
for the partuuid under all circumstances. Now we use "blkid" instead.
This fixes #1028.

author: jens-maus
message: updated build environment to use latest OCCU 2.25.15 release. This closes #5.

made checkUsreBackup.sh executable

author: jens-maus

lets use separate steps for adding a APT key using "apt-key add" so that
wget download errors are revealed correctly.

updated NEOserver package to latest 2.4.7 version and added a helper
script to make future updates of NEOserver way easier.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated more minor webui style fixes for displaying the user table
with full width and the device table with the same border width than the
other tables.

author: jens-maus
message:
further tuning of createBackup.sh to catch potential mod time errors
when using --verify with tar. Thus, using "--verify" does not seem to be
a nice approach and we better just use "gzip -t" and "tar tf" to partly
test file integrity of backup archives.

author: jens-maus
message: enabled SNMP server support by enabling ntpsnmpd support which in fact will bring in net-snmpd which we will use to provide full SNMP support to query the status of RaspberryMatic in a future version. This refs #115.

author: jens-maus
message:
updated OCCU to 3.51.6-7 which comes with a fixed libxmlparser.so
library fixing an issue with <pre>/<script> tag parsing which resulted
in problems when having a 'pre' or 'script' variable in the tclrega
interface to run rega scripts from tcl. This closes #230.

from 1.5GHz to 1.8GHz for potentially increased performance.
This refs #1913.

streamlined all our raspberrypi linux kernel defconfigs with the
standard defconfigs of the 5.4.x kernel line. This should also fix
recent issues with the thermal driver not working correctly for the rpi3
and rpi4 targets caused by the switch to aarch64.

author: jens-maus
message: enabled CONFIG_PREEMPT in our defconfig to generate a low-latency type of kernel again. While this doesn't provide as low latency as a full real-time kernel it should improve latency to some extend. This refs #21.

implemented a new WebUI patch to force addon version download URLs to
carry a valid text/plain content-type no matter what the corresponding
addon URL returns. This fixes #480.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a fix in /bin/ha-proxy.js which checks for the used character
encoding in the response and then either converts the buffer stream to a
string using utf8 or latin1. This fixes #1264. Furthermore, reworked the
whole response interception to use a dedicated responseInterceptor() as
provided by http-proxy-middleware. This should also slightly improve the
whole process of modifying the response body while keeping the rest of
the request/response as close to the original as possible.

reworked /etc/init.d/S11InitRFHardware once more to use the last 4
digits of the SGTIN together with 0xFF0000 to generate a new BidCos
address in case the returned bidcos address using hmip-copro-update.jar
is 0x000000. Furthermore, finally writing out the rf module info into
/var/ids, etc. has been slightly optimized. This refs #900.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented new WebUI patch which allows to disable service messages for
each device. Now a user can disable any service message generation by
unchecking a "service messages" checkbox in the device configuration
dialog. This will result in service messages to be hided for this
particular device until the checkbox is selected again. This refs #222
and finally implements a possibility to silence selected devices which
are currently not used (e.g. during certain seasons).

author: jens-maus
message:
add more virtio kernel modules to support more individual features of
the virtualization environments we support (especially
proxmox/virtualbox). In addition, we add virtio console support so that
the upcoming guest additions will have the correct communication channel
character device. This refs #744.

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'master' into multilib

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed bug in new delayed diagram storage functionality where on systems
without a forced usb stick (e.g. OVA platform) old measurement data was
never copied over from the old storage path and thus diagrams always
started from scratch on every reboot.

author: jens-maus
message: updated occu commit id to latest master branch version.

author: jens-maus
message:
disable CONFIG_BOOTPARAM_HUNG_TASK_PANIC kernel option as we better get
hung tasks reported instead of seemingly hard rebooting the system.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated a new WebUI patch kindly provided by @jp112sdl and enhanced
it to use the jsonOutput of /bin/updateDCVars.tcl to display the content
of the DutyCycle variables rather than using listBidCosInterface calls
to query dutycycle values via the interfaces.

author: jens-maus
message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/jens-maus/RaspberryMatic

author: jens-maus
message: add port 161 for SNMP monitoring.

author: jens-maus
message: bumped OCCU version to 3.37.8-2 incorporating latest changes.

author: jens-maus

patchset accordingly.

author: jens-maus
message: if thermal_zone0 doesn't exist we don't run into an error anymore.

author: jens-maus

author: jens-maus
message:
don't execute /bin/checkHmIPdevices.sh in S62HMServer or this might
result in moving away *.ap files of an old RF module which the user is
about to replace with a new one. This could have resulted in all HmIP
devices to vanish because no *.ap/apkx/bbkx file is then present
anymore upon switching.

author: jens-maus
message: add missing "mod_openssl" lighttpd module to default configuration.

author: IT-VBFK

author: jens-maus
message: we omit timestamp in our diff labels altogether because they are not relevant at all in that context.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented some basic support for the RPI-RF-MOD LED management with a
HB-RF-USB adapter PCB. This closes #640.

author: jens-maus
message: added RaspberryPi3+ (a020d3) as a new support RaspberryPi hardware in S01InitHost.

author: jens-maus
message:
updated OCCU to latest 3.47.22-2 and retired the
0052-WebUI-Fix-ESP-Security as it has been integrated in latest OCCU.

author: jens-maus
message: added --exclude-tag=.nobackup as a tar backup archiving option so that that content of directories with a ".nobackup" file will be completely ignored. This refs #179.

author: jens-maus

author: jens-maus

author: jens-maus
message:
streamlined the I2C kernel config options with the main raspberrypi
defconfig so that potentially we get rid of some i2c related issues
(see #863).

author: jens-maus
message: added rega-script specific syntax highlighting rules to codemirrors' clike.js so that now the script editor will syntax highlight code added to it.

author: jens-maus
message:
add BR2_JLEVEL to top-level Makefile to be able to set the number of
parallelization during build.

author: jens-maus

fixed rpi4 kernel defconfig to correctly setup a framebuffer device with
the current uboot changes/fixes.

author: jens-maus
message: skip the fsck.fat step as fsck.fat will not work on the bootfs.vfat files anyway.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated first basic support for HB-RF-USB by identifying it via lsusb
and setting the raw-uart device ndoe to /dev/raw-uart1 instead.

author: jens-maus
message:
retired the /bin/setHWClock.sh helper script which should not be
required anymore since the NTP server + kernel will synchronize the
system time regularly to a connected RTC on its own and trying to do
that on our own will only interfere with this.

author: jens-maus
message:
added index.cgi to allowed index file names so that the /upnp/index.cgi
actually works as expected.

author: jens-maus
message:
added changes to 0001-RaspberryMatic and 0012-WebUI-RecoveryButton WebUI
patch to disable non necessary WebUI features if running in a Docker /
OCI environment. This closes #1083.

slightly improved RPI-RF-MOD recognition by checking for 0x..ffff rather
than 0x00ffff because newer models seem to have different address ids
than expected (cf.
https://github.com/alexreinert/debmatic/commit/abf48622f0ffb3b1202a7ce40dea2d569177f0da)

author: jens-maus

author: jens-maus
message:
added new WebUI patch which fixes the regexp uses for parsing the output
of a "date -Iseconds" command which has changed since BusyBox 1.33.0 to
be more ISO-8601 compliant. Now the used regexp should catch all cases.
This fixes an internal error in the WebUI that was reported lately
(https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=65840&p=649371#p649371)

author: jens-maus
message: added irqbalance startup check for systems with less than 2 cpus/cores

switch to softprops/action-gh-release which provides the necessary
upload_url output

author: jens-maus
message: reverted our rootfs-overlay restructuring and seperated all overlay files depending on the components they should belong to (WebUI, HMServer, rfd)

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated a new default cronjob that performs a nightly back blocks
check via /sbin/badblocks and triggers an alarm message via monit if
a bad block is found on the main device. Thanks to @jp112sdl for the
nice idea!

author: jens-maus
message:
added another improvement for the 0119-WebUI-Fix-ProofAndSetValue WebUI
patch which fixes the broken floating point / ProofAndSetValue use of the
COND_TX_THRESHOLD_LO and COND_TX_THRESHOLD_HI value for HmIP-based
powermeter devices like the HmIP-PSM. (cf.
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&p=677137#p677136)

author: jens-maus
message:
created a new "raspberrypi4" target product because the rpi4 platform
seem to require an own build target to catch the differences in uboot +
linux-kernel settings.

author: jens-maus
message:
added "-x jitter" to standard DAEMON_ARGS so that the time consuming
JITTER entropy source is omitted and the hwrng or urandom be used
providing more entropy throughput anyway. This fixes #1817.

author: jens-maus
message:
reintroduce tar_prefix=rootfs management in post-image.sh to get buildx
running again.

author: jens-maus
message: Fundamental update.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated a new WebUI fix patch to fix the accidently removed
notepad image and possibility in then branches of WebUI programs.
This fixes #908
(https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=34&t=60936).

author: jens-maus
message:
modified clone_system.cgi to also deal with clone operations where the
target device is smaller than the source device. In this case the user
partition will be created smaller before using rsync to copy the userfs
data from source to destination.

author: jens-maus
message:
added new WebUI bugfix patch
(0176-WebUI-Fix-HeatingControl-BWTHSwitchState) which fixes an issue
with missing valve states for channel 10 of a HmIP-BWTH device due to
not specific enough table identifiers being used. This fixes #2192.

Co-authored-by: Jerome Pech <jp112sdl@icloud.com>

author: jens-maus
message:
if /etc/config/disableOnboardLED exists we disable all onboard LEDs
(e.g. the onboard RaspberryPi leds).

author: jens-maus
message:
adapted usbmount.rules in /lib/udev so that we prevent
bootfs/rootfs/userfs to be accidently mounted in case the partuuid is
somewhat screwed and thus the usbmount prg might be run and then end up
mounting the maint media twice. This refs
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=62833

author: jens-maus

we use an own LATEST-VERSION.js @ raspberrymatic.de rather than using a
public cdn where due to excessive caching an update of the file could

author: pfetzing
message:
The fstab should have an fsck (if needed) (#405)

According to the manpage of fstab, setting the pass to 2 should have fsck check the filesystem after other filesystems.
Setting pass to zero means fsck will not check this filesystem.

I have successfully tested this on my Raspberry Pi as it previously had issues when losing power and would require me to manually check the userfs filesystem and repair errors. After setting pass to 2 it didn't require that any more.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed another bug in the set device profile WebUI mechanisms which
prevented to use the "&" character because the URL parameter & splitting

fixed issue in hmlangw daemon where during bootloader setup the daemon
could end up in an endless loop never starting and outputting massive
eq3loop_write_master() kernel errors due to serial data flooding. We now
check for a second bootloader reply scheme after sending the initial
bootloader entering sequrence. This fixes #2340.

author: jens-maus
message:
revised the 0062-WebUI-Fix-SortFavoritesCombobox WebUI patch and
implemented a manual favorite sorting functionality in the WebUI
instead. Now, a user can manually sort entries in the user favorite list
so that the corresponding combobox on the main startpage will now
display the manually sorted favorites instead of forcing a alphabetical
sorting. In addition, a logged in user can now only see its own
favorites rather than also showing all favorites of an admin or other
user. This refs #706.

author: jens-maus
message:
slightly reworked checkHmIPdevices.sh helper script to use a better
search pattern and only move away ap/apkx files if the regadom already
contains HmIP-RCV devices which means that there are references to the

already and thus the ap/apkx of the GPIO rf modules were accidently

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a new delayed diagram storage mechanism which will make sure
that the rrd files of the HMIPServer diagram functionality are only
saved in fixed time intervals (every 10 minutes) rather than as soon as
they are updated. This should prevent that USB/SD cards die way to early
since the rrd files can be updated too often. In addition, they usually
store the updated data on the same disk blocks and thus run too fast
into the maximum memory cell limitation. Now the new mechanism will also
make sure that different cells are used on every rrd file update and
thus prevent the wear leveling to be exhausted too fast.

author: jens-maus
message:
For some yet unknown reasons we have to use CONFIG_OF_EMBED in the rpi0,
rpi2 and rpi3 uboot configurations or otherwise a system won't boot as
soon as our rpi-rf-mod dtoverlay is added to config.txt. However,
CONFIG_OF_BOARD seems to work for the rpi4 platform. Nevertheless, this
definitly requires some more work but fixes #1378 for the moment.

This reverts commit 6995f7fc0adeee93b1714ca235e6cfe43d361e87.

author: jens-maus
message:
reworked /etc/init.d/S11InitRFHardware to seperately query the rf
address of HmIP (with hmip-copro-update.jar) and HmRF (with
eq3configcmd) because a dualcopro has two seperate rf addresses for
both homematic worlds. In addition, we generate an own bidcos rf address
now in case eq3configcmd returns an invalid rf address in the range
of 0xFF0000-0xFFFFFE because this is a range that should not be used
by any other homematic/BidCos device out there, thus should not
overlap. Furthermore, in case hmip-copro-update.jar returns an error in
the first run we call it again to retrieve the hmip rf address. Last not
least, we (re)use the hmip_address.conf and ids file from /etc/config in
case they exist because they allow to set a permanent rf address for
both homematic worlds. This refs #900.

This should slightly improve the general memory footprint and also
potentially increase performance in critical memory situations.

message:
added a Carrier Sense monitoring to /bin/updateDCVars.tcl. Now, if an
RPI-RF-MOD device is found to be present its "CARRIER_SENSE_LEVEL"
parameter is queried and in case it reaches >80% a warning is added to
the syslog. Furthermore, if the carrier sense level reaches >= 98% an
CarrierSense-Alarm is triggered so that users are notified.

message:
reduce the -t XX timeout option when calling udhcpc for obtaining an IP
address so that it only waits up to ~1 min for an IP address and then
continue in background. This should significantly increase the bootup
times in cases where no DHCP is present or does not have a free IP
address left.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a new WebUI fix patch which will finally fix using a ^
character in the script editor. Previously, the WebUI script editor
didn't allow to use the ^ character in the editor window or at least
didn't allow to save any script containing any ^ character. This was
caused, because the script editor functionality uses the raw/super
string functionality within ReGa and thus ^ chars are usually not
allowed. Nowe a meta escape sequence "@$@%" is used to replace the ^
char when supplied to the internal esp function and then unescaped
accordingly. This should finally solve the issues and fixes #225.

author: jens-maus

author: jens-maus

author: jens-maus
message:
after thorough investigation, the commits e187501 and 5e0ab71 have been
largely reverted while keeping the tclrega+tclrpc sources at the current
state of affairs so that a proper charset encoding conversion is
performed within tclrega+tclrpc while tcl is now defaulting to the
iso8859-1 encoding again. While this is largely a revert to the state of
affairs of the 3.63.8.20220330 release this closes #1825 and refs #1821
and brings us back to the state of #1782 where certain external addons
like hm_pdetect have to be partly reworked to get character encoding
fixed. However, the WebUI itself should now correctly work with these
reverts.

author: jens-maus
message:
added new rpi-rf-mod-rpi1 device tree overlay to rpi-rf-mod package and
added it to our rpi0 platform generation. This should fix issues were on
a RaspberryPi1 system no act-led (led0) node was generated in
/sys/class/leds because of the default rpi-rf-mod.dtbo device tree
overlay being partly invalid for a RaspberryPi1 due to the missing GPIO
pins. This fixes #1284.

author: jens-maus
message:
retired the cryptool type checking of backup archive consistency since
this will not work with the current key be supplied. Thus, this
crypttool check is not really of any use and restoreBackup.sh should
just blindly restore a backup instead - which in fact should be its main
purpose in first place. This fixes #566.

author: jens-maus

added 'nofail' mount option where appropriate so that upon startup the
system doesn't complain if a certain fs is missing.

author: jens-maus
message: added "disk-signature" to genimage.cfg so that we can boot using PARTUUID= specifiers in the kernel command-line. In addition, S00eQ3SystemStart will query the new disk identifier after using parted to resize the /usr/local partition. This refs #103.

author: jens-maus

specify local psplash patches and moved the 0001-logo.patch to a
dedicated "raspmatic" subdirectory which will be used instead. This
allows to specify seperate patch directories now for each product so
that different logos can be presented using psplash.

author: jens-maus

pieeprom.upd/sig files which we can put into the bootfs partition of the
rpi4 image so that a rpi4 (if booted from USB) will be able to update
its EEPROM immediately. This refs https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/pull/939

author: jens-maus
message:
modified 0060-WebUI-Fix-SessionLogoutSave WebUI patch to not patch the
Session.logout() JSON RPC to use system.ClearSession() rather than
system.ClearSessionID() because using the non-ID version causes the
regadom to be saved under all circumstances and for the remote API this
might not be something we actually want. This refs #1192.

author: jens-maus
message: remove /etc/init.d/S01USBGadgetMode as not required for OCI platform

author: jens-maus
message: modified backup create routines to use /usr/local/tmp rather than a RAM disk. Also, lighttpd+cp_security will now use X-Sendfile to send out the final backup file. This finally solves issues with creating backups where /usr/local is filled more than half the memory size of the machine RaspberryMatic runs on. This refs #23.

author: jens-maus
message:
get rid of the cp210x modprobe udev rule entry since we are using
raw-uart from now on for the HmIP-RFUSB.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a first version of a detect_radio_module external buildroot
package which will compile and use the new 'detect_radio_module' tool
from Alexander Reinert in future, helping to simplify the RF module
init and parameter query mess in /etc/init.d/S11InitRFHardware (TBD).

author: jens-maus
message:
added a new 0133-WebUI-Fix-AlarmSysVarInternal WebUI patch which
combines the EnumIDs() and EnumEnabledInternalIDs() of the
oUser.UserTempViewIDs() usage when displaying alarm variables. This is
necessary because the UserTempViewIDs are IseIdArrays for which EnumIDs
does not return sysvars which are flagged as "internal". This prevented
the alarm display from showing the relevant alarm variable if it was
flagged as internal.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a new mechanisms to set a custom storage path for e.g.
storing the diagrams and nightly backup in a user configurable path. Now
users can set an own path in /etc/config/CustomStoragePath which should
be used for storage them. This should allow to specify, e.g. a network
path or a path on an external storage drive which is not as problematic
as storing this data on a microSD card device. This closes #914.

message:
added a new WebUI patch (0065-WebUI-Fix-CountUsageStalling) which should
slightly improve all time costly uses of ChnLinkCount() and
ChnDPUsageCount() uses in the WebUI which was also the reason why the
"Gewerke" admin listing could take too long and thus block ReGaHss
resulting in monit triggering a restart under certain conditions. Thanks
to @jp112sdl for debugging and suggesting fixes. This fixes #751.

author: jens-maus
message:
reworked whole kernel config management by prefering to use kconfig
fragment files and kernel supplied defconfigs which are then overrided
by the fragment files. This should make sure that future kernel updates
should pickup new options/changes automatically. Furthermore, this
allows to better group common kernel options in the "kernel" directory.
Overall, this make the whole kernel config option management a bit more
easier to maintain in future, especially if new supported platforms will
be introduced.

message:

necessary changes to get the HmIP-RFUSB supported in the WebUI as a
full-fledged Advanced IP Routing Gateway device similar to a RPI-RF-MOD.
This will bring up the CarrierSense measures and create a dedicated
maintenance device and :0 channel from which additional parameters can
be quieried. Furthermore the HmIP-RFUSB has now been added to a support
device in S62HMServer and the regular dutycycle updating functionality.

author: jens-maus
message:
Revert "Merge branch 'tcl-update'"

This reverts commit 637217b8cdf55fac6cdadcf3864f74a1f80c6bdd, reversing
changes made to 9edb950210de4b1d476f9413255dd03894e80ba8.

This in fact reverts back to using tcl8.2 on the main branch since
integrating tcl8.6 requires some RemoteAPI changes to ReGaHss first so
that a RemoteAPI call can also be sent using utf-8 encoding and thus
ReGaHss automatically converting it into iso8859-1 internally first.

Thus, we are continuing our tcl version update stuff on a dedicated
branch for now and keep master clean from it.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a new "Check+Repair Storage" option in the recovery system
which can be used to initiate a manual filesystem check and repair
operation which can be used to try to check for any severe filesystem
errors and trying to repair them accordingly. In addition, a detailed
bad block check will be performed using this new recovery system
functionality. Note, however, that running this new check+repair can
take considerable time (minutes to hours) depending on the underlaying
storage system.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a specific "Content-Length" header check to lighttpd.conf which
will allow http post/put requests with "transfer-encoding: chunked" to
be processed correctly. This seems to finally allow to use the new
"ingress_stream" option in the HA add-on config file and thus make
ingress-based large file upload > 16MB possible (cf.
https://redmine.lighttpd.net/issues/2156). This closes #1294 and
refs https://github.com/home-assistant/supervisor/issues/2950

slightly reworked createBackup.sh to automatically identify if the
specified command line option is a directory or file and thus do not

restoring anything that might be not complete. This refs #539.

machines being reachable via their names. Thus this closes #2399.

author: jens-maus
message:
added an additional "sleep 5" after successfull multimacd startup to
provide underlying operating systems a bit more time for settlement and
permission setup to the dynamically generated /dev/mmd_* devices. This
should help in case of newer HomeAssistantOS 9.0+ environments which
seem to require a bit more time before rfd/HMIPServer can successfully
access these multimacd devices. This fixes #1942 and refs https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/issues/2133

author: jens-maus
message:
force lighttpd into "server.network-backend=writev" because users were
reporting issues with X-Sendfile: transfers not being properly
transfered for certain platform (e.g. tinkerboard). Forcing the network
backend to "writev" or "write" seems to solve this issue, thus lighttpd
might not chose the optimum here. (cf.
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=74631&start=110#p725332).

author: jens-maus
message:
added some rather conservative network performance tuning to
/etc/sysctl.conf which increases net.core.Xmem_max to 4 MiB to
potentially increase the network performance. Also added an increase of
the allowed IGMP memberships to 1024 to provide more room for addons to
potentially come up with own IGMP membership uses (cf.
https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/pull/1968).

author: jens-maus
message:
changed CONFIG_NF_CONNTRACK to not compile the netfilter conntrack
firewall functionality as a kernel module but directly integrate it into
the kernel so that we can set net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_max and
net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_buckets to reasonable values in
/etc/sysctl.conf. This should solve issues where users reported
issues with "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet" kernel messages (cf. https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=73881)

author: jens-maus
message:
added some first basic support for the new RaspberryPi Zero 2 W model by
using the rpi3 platform for it (since it is sharing the same CPU/SoC).
However, as the latest stable RaspberryPi kernel+firmware does not yet
support this new model we manually download the device tree binaries
from the raspberrypi/firmware GitHub project in post-image.sh. Also
adapted the S01InitHost accordingly so that the Zero 2 W is identified
as "rpi3z2w".

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a new "check" target which will run some consistency checks
like checking if our own buildroot packages are using the right syntax
as well as checking if our main buildroot package (OCCU) can be build
separately. Thus, we use this new "check" target in our ci.yml workflow
from now on so that consistency errors are revealed as early as
possible.

added the options "-I 256 -E lazy_itable_init=0,lazy_journal_init=0" to
all mkfs.ext4 calls so that all ext4 filesystems will be created with
>y2038 compatibility (inode size >= 256) and also with slightly optimized
init procedures (no lazy inits). This refs https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/pull/1589

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a new monit-based watchdog check which in case of using a
RaspberryPi4 regularly checks if an onboard USB3 port is used together
with a GPIO connected rf module (RPI-RF-MOD/HM-MOD-RPI-PCB) and output a
WebUI alarm if identified. This is motivated by the common problem that
a RaspberryPi4 is known to produce significant rf interference which
could negatively affect the rf communication and thus a user have to be
warned that the combination of a Pi4+USB+GPIO is not a good idea.
However, for use cases where a user wants to disable that regular
watchdog check a file /etc/config/rpi4usb3CheckDisabled can be
generated. This refs https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=69421

the WebUI a bit more consistent.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a fio-based disk performance check to fwinstall.sh which
will output performance data of the used storage device (sd card, etc.)
and also may give a hint if the performance might result in lengthy
firmware update procedures. This fio-based performance check is largly
based on the raspberry pi agnostics test, which also uses fio for
deriving sd card related performance measure. (cf.
https://github.com/raspberrypi-ui/agnostics)

message:
exclude /jpages/ urls from the charset encoding conversion because
HMIPServer always seem to send in utf-8 but unfortunately without
explicitly adding 'charset=utf-8' to the content-type. This resulted in
broken charset conversions like for umlauts if used in the groups,
diagram and other HMIPServer delivered WebUI portions. This fixes #2139

author: jens-maus
message:
modified wifi network setup to check for a /boot/SetupWIFI file and in
case it exists during bootup we generate the corresponding
/etc/config/wpa_supplicant.conf file automatically. This should allow to
setup a WIFI connection by just adding a file "SetupWIFI" to the FAT32
based boot partition (SSID in first line, Password on second line) and
the WiFi connection should then be automatically started upon start.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a shell version of an ArgonONE/FAT HAT support daemon that
will automatically identify a used ArgonONE case or Argon FAT HAT and
use the same fancontrol mechanisms like the python driven control daemon
distributed by Argon itself. In addition, the daemon will monitor the
GPIO line 4 for the power button control and allow to reboot a system by
a simply double tap. This closes #863.

author: HMside
message:
not needed colon

For some devices e.g. water sensor, combi sensor or motion detector in
the WebUI was no datapoint description name displayed. E.g. „no error“,
„no motion“, „dry“, „battery ok“, „currently no rain“ has no name
before the state. Thus the extra colon is not required.

author: jens-maus
message:
reworked /bin/triggerAlarm.tcl to allow to generate the alarm variable
as a pure internal alarm variable which will hide it from the standard
WebUI but make it still usable as a full-fledged alarm variable. This
finally allowed to rework all our triggerAlarm.tcl uses throughout
different place (monitrc, cronBackup.sh, updateDCVars.tcl, etc.) so that
for every WatchDog alarm a dedicated alarm variable with the name
"WatchDog: XXXXX" is generated whee XXXXX is specific to the alarm type.
This should make the whole WatchDog alarm mechanisms more usable. Thus,
this refs #1321.

author: jens-maus
message: added 'clean' and 'distclean' target to buildroot Makefile and updated .gitignore file to ignore year based buildroot directories.

author: jens-maus

remove the /bin/checkBadBlocks.sh check for the OCI platform and also
get rid of regular fstrim usage via daily cron execution which is also
not required in a docker/OCI environment.

author: jens-maus
message:
lets try to build our recovery system way faster by reusing already
build stuff from the main buildroot build. This should significantly
improve our build times allowing our build to finish in time so that the
GitHub runners won't cancel it after 6 hours.

author: jens-maus
message:
adapted 0144-WebUI-ControlForMaintenanceChannel WebUI patch to show
details of the maintenance channel to not show the raw RSSI values but
to substract 256 from it before using these values as dBm values (cf.
https://forum.fhem.de/index.php?topic=106900.0). In addition, we show
"n/a" if the RSSI value is lower than -200 because this is known to be
not a real RSSI value but potentially an artifcat in the raw RSSI value.

author: jens-maus
message:
increased server.max-read-idle and server.max-write-idle to 1800 seconds
(30 min) so that large file uploads/downloads will not run into a
webserver timeout on slow hardware platforms or slow SD card
environments anymore. This refs #1336 and
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=67419.

potentially notify the user of the occurred event.

author: jens-maus
message:
upon factory reset operation we make sure to force the PARTUUID to
"0xDEEDBEEF" under all circumstances even if no repartitioning is
necessary. This should fix cases where due to certain misconfigurations
the PARTUUID changes and thus misbehaviour might result. Thus, a factory
reset operation now also resets the PARTUUID and not only reformats
userfs. This refs https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=62833

adapted the latest CSP security patch to include the gitcdn URL to query
for newer firmware devices for RaspberryMatic. Also added "X-WebKit-CSP"
response header to serve older webbrowsers as well. In addition, neither
lighttpd nor ReGa will now output any "Server:" response header anymore
to prevents detailed analyses on the web server type. This refs #597.

npmrc file and use "npm config set/get" accordingly. This fixes #823.

author: jens-maus

we use an offset for the start of the boot partition of the x86
platforms so that the bootloader can be updated as well in future.

limit access-deny to non-localhost requests so that on localhost one can
still perform rega scripting requests on port 80+443.

we use "monit stop/start XXXX" stop/start required homematic services
before/after the restor operation. This fixes #612.

author: jens-maus

make sure to have the disk-activity LED trigger available on all
platforms.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated fix in 0031-WebUI-Fix-FileUpload WebUI patch which fixes a
broken HTTPS certificate file upload which was not storing the pem file
at the correct location. This fixes #2322.

message: final version bump

author: jens-maus
message:
strip any whitspace from the retrieved webversion in
checkAddonUpdates.sh. This should fix issues where online check for
newer addon versions might return version information with invalid
whitespaces (cf.
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?p=680973#p680973)

author: jens-maus
message:
add new intel-nuc platform/board to start with general x86_32 support
targeting mainly intel-nuc hardware.

author: jens-maus
message:
added an additional -b backup option to the new checkFirmwareUpdate.sh
script allowing to perform a standard sbk backup before applying a
firmware update. This refs #1857

author: jens-maus
message: fall back to plain "ReGaHss" if "ReGaHss.normal" or "ReGaHss.community" do not exist.

author: jens-maus
message: Update README.md

author: jens-maus
message:
added rcS/rcK without any psplash-write calls which are not necessary
for the oci platform.

author: jens-maus
message: updated OCCU to 3.65.6-1 and adapted all dependencies accordingly.

author: jens-maus
message: minor german translation rephrasing.

author: jens-maus
message:
added CONFIG_DAX and some other kernel options to enhance support for
virtio-fs (cf.
https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/pull/1400)

author: jens-maus
message:
improved the SSH init script to check for the start-stop-daemon return
codes and also start the daemon in foreground so that a proper error
message is returned in case the SSH daemon could not be started.
(This refs
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?p=700553#p700550)

author: jens-maus
message:
modified top-level buildroot patches integration to use seperate patch
directories to integrate the patches for using create_patches.sh to
update the *.patch files accordingly.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a HB-RF-ETH monitoring entry to /etc/monitrc which will monitor
the connection status of a HB-RF-ETH using readout of the
/sys/class/hb-rf-eth/hb-rf-eth/is_connected sysfs entry.

author: jens-maus
message: finalized support for S.USV UPS hardware by integrating a startup script and using a slightly patched version of the susvd daemon as well as using a notify.sh notification script to execute triggerAlarm on power loss. This closes #98.

author: jens-maus
message: updated licenseinfo.htm with version in CCU3 firmware release.

author: jens-maus
message:
modified 0004-LocalSSLCert WebUI patch and S50lighttpd startup script to
use elliptic curve based algorithms when generating the private key and
https certificates.

author: jens-maus
message: implemented a USB auto-update feature that allows to put a file "ccu-update.bin" on a USB memory stick and have it connected while booting into the recovery system. This will then immediately update the firmware if the ccu-update.bin file will be a valid firmware update file.

author: jens-maus
message:
removed CONFIG_NET_FOU_IP_TUNNELS to get rid of unnecessary ip6tnl0
interface.

author: jens-maus

integrated changes to the HA add-on configuration for upcoming
functionality.

reapplied patch for prototype.js by wernerf/eQ3 to make sure
ShowAjaxLoad/HideAjaxLoad is called and iso-8859-1 encoding enforced
when using prototype.js

author: jens-maus

added /etc/config/NoFSRIM and /etc/config/NoBadBlocksCheck status file
checks so that the weekly fstrim and daily backblocks check can be more
easily disabled by users in case they like to.

author: jens-maus
message:
we only remove and readd a favorite entry to a user favorite list in
case it is initially added or removed. This should fix the problem that
upon editing a favorite it will always be added to the very end of the
user favorite list. This refs #706.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a smoother timezone/utcOffset/utcOffsetDST calculation
routine which doesn't require to maintain an own utcOffset list in
addition to the anyway mostly obsolete timezone list implemented in
cp_time.cgi. Now the utcOffset and position sync functionality in latest
WebUI doesn't require this utcOffset list anymore while allowing to set
way more time zones.

didn't work with the latest ReGaHss session ID generation anymore. Now
it will retrieve a new session ID right after having authenticated a
user rather than first getting a session ID (which isn't possible
anymore without any authentication).

author: jens-maus
message:
changed the way WebUI patches are handled for patching changes into
webui.js. Now patchsets have to be performed on the unwrapped (human
readable) copies of webui.js rather than on the wrapped versions. This
should allow to perform changes on the CHANNELCHOOSER_JST, CHANNEL_CONFIG_DIALOG_JST, etc.
parts more easily and in a human readable form. For this the occu
package will now automatically unwrap and rewrap the webui.js before and
after applying the WebUI patches. This should hopefully make future OCCU
updates more easy and straight forward.

builds.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a "-e 1" option to the bad blocks check so that the bad blocks
check aborts immediately on the first bad block rather than continuing
until the end of the device. This should help to prevent potential
crashes in case severely broken disks are currently in use and also
prevent that the badblocks.txt result file will eat all memory in /tmp.
(This refs
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=62135&p=615209#p615209)

author: jens-maus
message: added issue template chooser config.yml to disable blank issues, etc.

author: jens-maus
message:
slightly reworked restoreBackup.sh to check all included archive
checksums before actually starting a backup restore. In addition, it
also makes sure now to really only extract files in the embedded
usr_local archive that are located in /usr/local. This should prevent
from accidently overwriting certain things in the rootfs or other
filesystem just because a user incorrectly patched the backup archive.

message:
added dedicated i2cset command to switch an ArgonONE case to "Always on"
mode according to https://github.com/Argon40Tech/Argon-ONE-i2c-Codes.

hardware revisions or firmwares (see
https://github.com/Argon40Tech/Argon-ONE-i2c-Codes/issues/1).

author: Steinweber
message:
added new 0153-WebUI-Fix-ImproveImgUpdates WebUI patchset which uses CSS methods to load the main logo and its 'red' variant. In addition, the dot images for the alarm and service messages will only be updated if there are any changes detected. This should slightly reduce the amount of regular work to be done in a timer event (#1552)

Co-authored-by: Jens Maus <mail@jens-maus.de>

author: jens-maus
message:
removed 0003-kernel-reset-module.patch from generic_raw_uart build again
and restructed the GPIO based rf-module reset to use different pins
for RPI-RF-MOD (pin 35) and HM-MOD-RPI-PCB (pin 12). In addition we set
the reset pin to an input pin again after the reset operation which will
switch the pins to a floating pin for ensuring a proper operating in
normal mode.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated modifications so that hss_led can be run in non-priviledged
mode under a dedicated hssled user context rather than root. This
required not only introduction of a user and group but also incorporates
a udev rule which will make sure the /sys/class/leds nodes have the
right permissions. Furthermore, hss_led also needs to create
/var/status/hasInternet and thus we had to modify global umask and
directory permissions for that part as well (this refs #599).

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a first basically working version of a process
watchdog/monitoring implementation using monit
(https://bitbucket.org/tildeslash/monit/). This watchdog should
automatically take care if one of the defined services (e.g.
ReGaHss) crashes and then automatically restart and also
potentially notify the user of the occurred event.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a new unclean shutdown or system crash identification watchdog.
Now upon an unclean shutdown (user unplug power or power outage) or upon
an unexpected system crash the monit watchdog will automatically
identify this event and raise an appropriate alarm message in the WebUI.
This should help to mainly identify an unexpected system crash so that
these are not getting unnoted anymore.
