author: jens-maus
message:
changed lighttpd startup/config to return "503 Service unavailable"
status codes if the CCU startup is not yet finished. This should prevent
potential runtime issues in case external engines like ioBroker or
HomeAssistant are trying to use remoteAPI ports when not all CCU
services are properly started. In addition, we now allow only certain
query URLs for port 8181/48181 for external queries.

added acpid daemon for all x86 targets (ova/intelnuc) so that systems
can be shutdown via acpi shutdown events. In addition we have to create

we remove unnecessary iwlwifi firmwares for intelnuc platform to
slightly reduce amount of root space taken. Last, not least we improve
the usbmount.rules to allow to automount from mmcblk devices also.

author: jens-maus
message:
disabled max-worker setting in global lighttpd.conf to get rid of
"(mod_cgi.c.822) fork failed: Cannot allocate memory" error messages in
lighttpd-error.log which seem to be caused by a too high max-worker
setting which seems not to be reliable according to https://redmine.lighttpd.net/projects/lighttpd/wiki/Server_max-workerDetails
This should hopefully make http uploads more reliable since large file
uploads seem to have not worked reliable enough.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed a bug where a HM-MOD-RPI-PCB connected to a HB-RF-USB didn't
initialize correctly in a OVA environment due to omitting the rf module
reset in previous versions. Now we make sure that if a
HB-RF-USB/HB-RF-USB-2 is used the rf module will be reset under all
circumstances. In addition we use "timeout 20" commands on all major
rf module query commands so that any potentially stalling query command
might not completely stall a bootup anymore.

author: jens-maus
message:
we have to set server.http-parseopts in global lighttpd.conf to disable
the url-ctrls-reject and url-path-2f-decode option or otherwise
third-party apps like hm_pdetect which encode complex textareas using
URL encoding might cause newer lighttpd versions to return "400 Bad
Request" messages. This fixes https://github.com/jens-maus/hm_pdetect/issues/77

author: jens-maus
message:
we move the bootfs partition position for the ASUS tinkerboard platform
to 1M so that we will have enough space between the u-boot end position
and the bootfs start position for actually updating u-boot during a
firmware update since on the ASUS tinkerboard U-boot is not stored
within the bootfs partition but ahead of it outside of the partition
table.

author: jens-maus
message:
severely improved the 0026-WebUI-Fix-CacheControl WebUI patch which will
not use _version_ parameters in URLs anymore to signal a browser to
fetch a new version of a js/css. Instead, we now use proper
Cache-Control: response headers supplied via lighttpd so that proper
ETag based caching mechanisms take place. In fact, this change should now
hopefully fix all remaining browser cache related issues when updating
from one release to another. In addition, the forced Cache-Control:
response headers will now also take care of proper web caching of
third-party addons also delivering web content.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed a bug in the firmware update routine for a HmIP-RFUSB where an
incorrect variable was used, thus a firmware update always failed. This
refs #1516.

author: jens-maus
message:
modified default kernel command line to use consoleblank with 120
instead of 0 so that the console will be automatically blanked after 2
minutes, thus a connected monitor to be switched in standby mode. In
addition, we automatically disable HDMI output on the RaspberryPi
platform if no HDMI cable is connected upon bootup. This should reduce
power consumption and also reduce/remove potential interferences with a
GPIO connected RF module like it had been reported since the 3.41.x line
of firmwares. This closes #500.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a first basic "Clone System" functionality in the recovery
system. Now users can use the recovery system to copy/clone their whole
system to other connected devices. This can be particular useful for
installing RaspberryMatic on a SSD of a IntelNUC so that the image can
be initially booted via a USB stick but then copied to the internal SSD
afterwards.

be directly shown but the ${XXXXX} translate key.

author: jens-maus
message:
added new 0018-grub2-fix-incompat-ext2 buildroot upstream patch which
patches grub2 to ignore certain newer ext filesystem features which
could hinder grub2 from correctly recognized an ext filesystem thought
it is still valid. This is especially critical for the metadata checksum
seed feature which since the latest e2fsck 1.47.0 version is now a
default settings, thus renders new ext filesystems as grub2 incompatible
without these upstream grub2 patches not part of buildroot yet. (cf.
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1031325,
https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1030939)

author: jens-maus
message:
partly reintroduced the use of an own 64bit version of libNRJavaSerial
because the hmip-copro-update.jar tool does not come with an on aarch64
version yet. So until eQ3 provides an updated hmip-copro-update.jar tool
we ship RaspberryMatic with an own copy of libNRJavaSerialv8.so again.
This closes #1387.

author: jens-maus
message:
improved /dev/urandom initialization by adding rndaddtoentcnt command
that will send an ioctl() command to the kernel to signal that some
entropy was added. This should remove all urandom warnings during bootup
and could potentially speed up bootup as well.

step.

Here oCH.HSSID() was used which should have been oDP.HSSID() from the start. Other occurances of the same mistake was also corrected accordingly.

more consistent.

author: jens-maus
message: modified u-boot defconfig files to use CTRL+X for stopping autoboot. Also set bootdelay to 0 to improve bootup times. Furthermore we patch the rpi u-boot config to enable boot retry time and disable serial output to interfere with the rf module.

author: jens-maus
message: renamed .empty to .gitkeep to make its purpose more clear.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a new /bin/checkCoProcessor.sh check script and put it to
the global monitrc to be executed regularly for performing a
rf-module/co-processor connectivity check. In case of identifying
a failed rf-module connection a WebUI alarm message will be raised.
This refs https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=73697

author: jens-maus
message:
added support for loading compressed kernel modules (xz and zstd) using
modprobe/kmod by adding BR2_PACKAGE_XZ and BR2_PACKAGE_ZSTD to all
buildroot configs. This closes #1750.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a forced firmware update process to S48UpdateRFHardware which
should catch cases where a HmIP-RFUSB might not have been correctly
flashed, thus might require a forced firmware update again. This should
make the firmware update process a bit more stable in critical
situations.

or spaces, where approriate.

ME.md)

introduce CCU_NETWORK_GATEWAY in install-docker.sh because an explicity
gateway setting is unfortunately also required in the docker network
setup so that the container will received the correct gateway address
and not always use the .1 in the last ip octet per default. Also
slightly reworked cleanup and error handling in the setup script to be
more conveniernt to end users.

author: jens-maus
message:
added noLED patch for raspi-fanshim package and also changed daemon
startup script to skip the daemon startup in case a HM-MOD-RPI-PCB is
used because the Fan SHIM and HM-MOD-RPI-PCB require the same GPIO.1 for
their correct operation and thus are incompatible. This refs #811.

author: jens-maus
message: added new /bin/checkInternet helper script that will be regularly executed to check the internet connection. This should solve issues where users experienced problems if they had a link-up/down event but at that time no internet was available. Now it will check for a valid internet connection every 3 minutes and signal the status via /var/status/hasInternet.

replaced all "exit $?" occurances in shell scripts with proper "exit 0"

in the old /usr/local/sdcard directory (e.g. on the local directory)
with a check for non-mcc (SD card) medias in general. This should enable

storing diagrams and daily backups. This closes #1026.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a qemu-guest-agent fsfreeze hook script for ReGaHss database
flushing so that before qemu fsfreeze (e.g. Proxmox backup) execution
the ReGaHss database will be flushed to disk which should improve
consistency of a snapshot-based backup.

author: jens-maus
message: updated upstream linux kernel to latest 5.10.96 LTS.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a package patch "0001-default-identity-encoding.patch" to the tcl
package to make the "identity" character encoding the default+system
encoding like it had been with tclsh 8.2 and which seem to have caused
the umlaut character encoding issues recently seen. In addition, adapted
tclrega and tclrpc accordingly so that they only actively perform
character conversion in case no "identity" encoding is used.
Furthermore, remove the explicit "convertto" char conversion calls in
jsonrpc.tcl so fix similar issues. This altogether should hopefully fix
the char encoding issues seen in the WebUI and external CCU addons
like hm_pdetect, etc. This refs #1782.

author: jens-maus
message:
try to be more conservative in querying the under-voltage bit using
vcgencmd by only querying for a current under-voltage rather than
checking if there were any under-voltage since startup. However, we try
to inform a user more quickly in using two cycles only. This should fix
minor issues when during startup a power supply may quickly go down
causing the Pi to register a short under-voltage which - during normal
operation - usually doesn't occur.

author: jens-maus
message:
reworked 0124-WebUI-Fix-ShowMultipleSpacesInSysVar to use a CSS style
statements to preserve each white space when showing the content of a
system variable rather than replacing them via " " statements.
While solving the initial issue of 0124 using CSS style methods should
prevent inline html code from getting mixed up by the " "
statements. This fixes #1375.

author: jens-maus
message:
the hmip-copro-update.jar command to query the SGTIN, copro firmware
version and bidcos rf-address doesn't seem to output the rf-address
anymore when using "-v -a" as the command options but an error is output
instead. Now we use a second call to hmip-copro-update.jar but use the
"-t -a" command-line options to let it output the decoded radio address.
This refs #900.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated changes to check for the existance of a RPI-RF-MOD module and
in case it does not exist we disable the Advanced LAN Routing features
in HMIPServer which are only available with a RPI-RF-MOD with 4.2.x
copro firmware. In addition, we show a WebUI popup warning in case a
user without a RPI-RF-MOD tries to use functionality that requires the
Advanced LAN Routing functionality. This should also fix error messages
in hmserver.log about the non working lanrouting.
(see
https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=61869&p=612555#p612555)

author: jens-maus
message:
added a new 0014-ca-certificates-local buildroot upstream patch which
will introduce the possibility to put own certificate authority (CA)
files into /usr/local/share/ca-certificates and use the
"update-ca-certificates" command commonly known from debian-like systems
to update the cert files in /etc/ssl/certs so that commands like curl,
wget and lighttpd can use the own CA files from there. Thus, upon
startup RaspberryMatic will now update ca certificates and allow users
to put own CA certificates into /usr/local/share/ca-certificates.
This closes #1910.

integrated a minor fix for the /bin/updateTZ.sh script which should
catch rare cases where an empty /etc/config/TZ file could have caused a

updateTZ.sh will now only update files in /etc/config in case something
was actually changed. This should omit write operations upon startup.
(This refs https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=61426)

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a new WebUI patch that allows to set an offset and duration
time for the astro timer functions. That means that one can create astro
timers now where a user can set something like e.g. "at sunrise minus/plus X
seconds". In addition, a user can now limit the astro timer duration if
wanted and not having it automatically ended at the opposite astro time.
Please note that for this WebUI patch to work a ReGaHss minimum version
of R1.00.0388.0217 is required.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated a change to 0072-WebUI-Fix-hm_autoconf to convert all ivtByte based
HSSDPs to ivtInteger using a sub routine in hm_startup. This fixes datatype
overflow/underflow issues (e.g. TIME_OF_OPERATION data point of HmIP-SWSD). Thus, now
substracting 256 from RSSI_xxxx data point values is not necessary
anymore, therefore 0144-WebUI-ControlForMaintenanceChannel was adapted
as well. This fixes #2008.

author: jens-maus
message:
removed rng-tools because in newer linux kernel versions /dev/random is
not blocking anymore (5.6+) and the standard kernel provied entropy pool is
strong enough (5.10+) so that tools like rng-tools or haveged are not
required anymore and just unnecessarily consume CPU time.
(cf. https://github.com/nhorman/rng-tools/issues/195#issuecomment-1520598021, https://forum.manjaro.org/t/low-entropy-on-my-system/119233)

daemon. This should prevent that we continue too fast on startup,
resulting in the NTP and other services not having a properly working
network connection.
(see https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=62143)

message:
we use /dev/shm as the primary upload directory and only use the on-disk

card media.

author: angelnu
message:
Support for docker/container images (#1056)

This PR integrates a first-hand implementation for generating docker/container versions of RaspberryMatic. Please note, that this is still partly WIP and not released yet. So if you are testing the docker implementation you are somehwat on your own until we release this to the public. However, please warmly welcome this new supported virtual platform for RaspberryMatic! 

Co-authored-by: Jens Maus <mail@jens-maus.de>

author: jens-maus
message:
we now store DHCP provided NTP server addresses in
/var/etc/ntp-dhcp.conf and use this file in the chrony/NTP server
startup and add these servers as local NTP servers to the complete NTP
server list. This should further improve the NTP server setup in user
environments where the NTP server address equals the central router and
where this router provides his own address as a valid NTP server.

author: gstrauss
message:
integrated different lighttpd web server optimizations (#1847, @gstrauss)

* enable mod_auth auth.cache
* reduce addr stringify in mod_authn_rega
* use recommended "stronger" TLS config (https://wiki.lighttpd.net/Docs_SSL#Perfect-Forward-Secrecy-PFS)
* reduce duplication in proxy configs
* obtain WebUI config from webui.conf
* use else conditions with exclusive conds
* include lighttpd_auth.conf in one place
* share TLS config with global scope (sharing TLS settings reduces memory used by openssl libs under lighttpd)
* simplify httpsredirect config
* removed /var/etc/lighttpd_proxy.conf generation and renamed proxy_normal.conf to proxy.conf only.
* commented out "#server.network-backend" in lighttpd.conf to use the default settings which should prefer sendfile and thus speed up non-TLS traffic. (cf. https://github.com/jens-maus/RaspberryMatic/pull/1847#issuecomment-1141325120)
* we don't have perl, thus remove the .pl cgi option.
* updated lighttpd 1.4.65 t(e9565b2bb0197e54310e1637813c915fcfe27944) which comes with a new "url-invalid-utf8-reject" http parse option in lighttpd which should allow the url normalization to still take place while allowing to have iso-8859-1 encoded percentage encoding in URLs (cf. https://github.com/jens-maus/RaspberryMatic/issues/1831#issuecomment-1136366509)
* enable server.graceful-restart-bg http opt lighttpd 1.4.65 allows for a graceful restart via SIGUSR1 in S50lighttpd.
* removed sleep 2 in S50lighttpd reload() function which is not necessary due to the graceful restart possibility.

Co-authored-by: Jens Maus <mail@jens-maus.de>

author: jens-maus
message:
As a directly integrated, powerful zeroconfig aware VPN solution a new
"tailscale" buildroot package has been implemented. This will provide
the necessary "tailscale" client and "tailscaled" daemon as well as a
basic startup/init file. This should provide a slim, free zeroconfig VPN
solution comparable to the CloudMatic solution. In contrast, tailscale
uses the free, secure and wireguard-based solution provided by the tailscale
open source project. By only having to create a /etc/config/tailscaleEnabled
config file and using the "tailscale up" startup command a powerful
point-to-point wireguard-based VPN mesh network can be build, allowing
to access your RaspberryMatic system like any other tailscale-aware
device.

author: jens-maus
message:
large overhaul of the general firmware update procedure. Now the vast
majority of the firmware update work is performed within the recovery
system routines rather than performing unarchiving, checksum check, etc.
operations in the general WebUI while the recovery system has this
functionality already implemented. This should hopefully solve all kind
of firmware update issues which popped up during the last few released
updates. This fixes #1336 and refs https://homematic-forum.de/forum/viewtopic.php?f=65&t=67419

author: jens-maus

integrated a first bunch of changes to get the kernel updated to version
6.1.x for all non-RaspberryPi systems.

author: jens-maus
message:
added BR2_PACKAGE_WIRELESS_REGDB package which will generate a
corresponding regulatory.db file the kernel can use for setup of
wireless connections. In addition, we drop the legacy CRDA functionality
in the kernel since regulatory.db is used since kernel 4.15+.
This refs https://github.com/home-assistant/operating-system/pull/1452

author: jens-maus
message: fixed shellcheck errors in /bin/checkCoProcessor.sh

author: jens-maus
message: added another minor style improvement to the 0039-WebUI-Fix-Style-Glitches WebUI patch which should better align the boundaries of the title and control area of popup windows.

author: jens-maus
message:
integrated some further improvements regarding network shutdown (e.g.
unmounting of network filesystems) and also integrated some minor
changes for a more clean shutdown with less warning/error messages in
the service console.

author: jens-maus
message:
fixed the broken StromPi2 daemon since the standard GPIO for running
strompi2 is now blocked by sysfs. Now we use wiringpi instead. In
addition, a user can now specify alternative options in the
/etc/config/strompi2 config file (e.g. GPIO_POWER=30) so that an
alternative GPIO line can be used for the StromPi2. This fixes #1413.

author: jens-maus
message:
implemented a change to the
0122-WebUI-ProgramExecutionWithConditionCheck WebUI patch which allows
to toggle the active/inactive button in case the login is an Admin
session. Thanks to @Maik2208 for having implemented the basics of it.
This refs #1292.

author: jens-maus
message:
added "set -e" to let createBackup.sh exit immediately upon an error.
Furthermore cronBackup.sh now triggers a WebUI alarm in case the target
dir could not be created ot the executed createBackup.sh exits wit an
error. This closes #1320.

author: jens-maus
message: reworked identify_host() function in S00eQ3SystemStart once more so that the uart0_base and uart0_irq parameter is correctly set for the bcm2835-raw-uart kernel module. This finally enabled HmIP support for ALL RaspberryPi hardware models. Voila!

fixed neoserver addon package to allow to uninstall the neoserver
completly again. This fixes #894.

author: jens-maus
message: modified addon install routines to install addon using local diskspace rather than solely using /tmp or /var. This should fix the problems with filled up /usr/local partitions which didn't fit into ramdisks anymore. This closes #23.

author: jens-maus
message:
added a multiline psplash patch which allows to use psplash-write to
output multiline messages as well. Thus, we change our rcS startup
scripts to output "Press ALT+F2 for service console" to remind users
that using ALT+F2 is enough to show a service console for maintenance
reasons.

which should make the new checkPortForwarding.sh working there as well.

author: jens-maus
message:
use "BR2_x86_corei7=y" for our intelnuc builds since intel nuc systems
always have sse until sse4.2. Thus we should be able to profit from
using more cpu features matching what is used in intel nuc systems.

author: jens-maus
message: create a /var/status/startupFinished file when all startup scripts are through. Together with a new hss_led this will allow to monitor if all major homematic services are up and running or otherwise a red led on the rpi-rf-mod signals that some service is actually not running (anymore).

author: jens-maus

author: jens-maus
message:
added a WebUI fix to bind the new DutyCycle ProgressBar display to the
content of the "DutyCycle" system variable generated by updateDCVars.tcl
or otherwise the progressbar and the variable could have slightly
different numbers. In addition, the DutyCycle sysvar update interval was
changed from every 3 minutes to every minute to be in sync with the new
WebUI way of displaying the DutyCycle.

author: jens-maus
message: reworked lighttpd startup script to use lighttpd-angel for startup. This allows to send a HUP signal to gracefully restart lighttpd and to even monitor crashes and restart it automatically. Also modified restartlighttpd.tcl to use this new functionality. This fixes #184.

author: jens-maus
message:
yet another try to get CONFIG_OF_BOARD running for all rpi platforms so
that the board's own device tree overlay is used instead. We had to,
however, add CONFIG_REQUIRE_SERIAL_CONSOLE=n to the uboot_defconfig
files as otherwise u-boot ends up in an endless loop in case the
rpi-rf-mod.dtbo changes the compatible entry of the uart0 entry and thus
would leave no serial console for u-boot. This should be a way better
fix for #1378 while keeping the improved CONFIG_OF_BOARD fix which we
had in mind in first place.

author: jens-maus

author: hoedlmoser
message:
direct ntpdate to use an unprivileged port ...

... for outgoing packets, as chrony already does. this should prevent NTP packets get filtered by some snake-oil security filtering on UDP packets with same src and dst port.

author: jens-maus
message:
modified the recovery system to add the user-configured static ip
address as a secondary ip address to the main network interface. Thus,
now the recovery system will also be available on the static ip address
a user has defined in the main WebUI, but also (for recovery reasons)
use a DHCP acquired IP address. This fixes #1862.

regression fix for rc.postlocal (#2449)

- fixes a regression between /etc/config/safemode and /usr/local/etc/rc.postlocal
